meanings.definition: A measure of disorder or randomness in a system
meanings.sent1: The scientist calculated the entropies of the molecules in the solution.
meanings.sent2: As time passed, the entropies of the room increased, leading to chaos.
meanings.sent3: The entropies of the party guests' seating arrangement made for an interesting game of musical chairs.
meanings.sent4: The entropies of the traffic flow mirrored the hectic pace of city life.
meanings.sent5: The entropies of the jumbled puzzle pieces made it impossible to solve.

meanings.definition: Lack of order or predictability; gradual decline into disorder
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house showed signs of entropies with its overgrown garden and broken windows.
meanings.sent2: The entropies of the old library were evident in the scattered books and dusty shelves.
meanings.sent3: The entropies of the mismatched socks drawer always caused a morning rush to find a pair.
meanings.sent4: The entropies of the neglected garden symbolized the passing of time.
meanings.sent5: The entropies of the disorganized schedule led to missed appointments.
